item4.title: Cards
item4.description: Attach cards (Visa, Mastercard or 'Mir' issued in Russia)

answer.text1: Humo transfers is a platform that allows users to transfer money from Russian cards (VISA, MasterCard and MIR) to any Korti Milli cards of Tajikistan and vice versa, make transfers to popular electronic wallets:
answer.text2: Humo Online, Megfon Life, Alif Mobi, Yandex money, DC Wallet , Qiwi and many others, pay utility bills, repay loans and much more.

item2.question: Who can use the application?
item2.answer: Any client who has Visa, MasterCard and MIR cards issued in Russia or a Korti Milli card of any bank in Tajikistan.

item3.question: How to transfer money to another card?

answer.text1: 1. Select the 'Transfer to card' option from the main screen.
answer.text2: Choose where you want to transfer money: 'To Tajikistan' or 'To Russia'. Enter the card number and amount in the Beneficiary field.
answer.text3: 2. In the new window, enter your card details and confirm the operation.

item4.question: How to transfer money to Humo Online account?

answer.text1: 1. Select the 'Transfer to Account' option on the main screen. In the recipient field, enter the phone number to which the recipient's account is attached and the amount (in rubles).
answer.text2: 2. In the new window, enter your card details and confirm the operation.
2. Click on the 'Add card' button and select which card you want to link. Russian card or Korti Milli.
answer.text3: 3. Fill in the card details and confirm 3D-Secure if it is a Russian card.
answer.text4: 4. Please wait while the card details are being verified.

item6.question: How to pay for services online?

answer.text1: 1. Click on the 'Payments' section and select the category you need (For example, Mobile communications).
answer.text4: 4. Enter your card details and confirm the transaction.

item7.question: What is CVV2/CVC2?
item7.answer: CVV2 or CVC2 is a special card code that is used to confirm authentication. This code is usually written on the back of the card. Visa Electron and MasterCard Maestro cards sometimes do not have a CVV2/CVC2 code. If your card does not have this code, you need to contact your bank and request the code.

item8.question: What are the limits for transferring and paying for services?
item8.answer: The minimum transfer or payment amount is 500 rubles, the maximum amount is 50,000 rubles.

item9.question: Is there a commission when transferring from Russia to Tajikistan?
item9.answer: The commission for transferring money from Russia to Tajikistan is 0.5%. Also, other banks may charge a commission, to whose cards you will send money. To find out more about the commissions of other banks, write to support.
